channel.title: Comments on: Hiking the Great Wall of China

item.title: By: awanda
item.dc:creator: awanda
item.description: I would say don't feel like a "poseur." Look at all the rest of us who are like, "Wow, this trip sounds fabulous," but wouldn't ever take the time off from work/life/partners to do it. That's quite an accomplishment. And traveling, no matter how it's done, is really a feat,especially this trip you're taking. When I first read about it on Amy's blog, I thought, "Nah, they're never gonna actually do it. It's just a pipe dream." But look at you two, you're really doing it. Going to China/Mongolia/Russia are not places that I would normally even consider, but China is sounding great and very interesting to read about it. As long as you're happy with your trip, that's the important thing. There will always be people that you think are doing something better/cooler/different than you, but only you have to be happy with your decisions. Enjoy!
item.content:encoded: I would say don’t feel like a “poseur.” Look at all the rest of us who are like, “Wow, this trip sounds fabulous,” but wouldn’t ever take the time off from work/life/partners to do it. That’s quite an accomplishment. And traveling, no matter how it’s done, is really a feat,especially this trip you’re taking. When I first read about it on Amy’s blog, I thought, “Nah, they’re never gonna actually do it. It’s just a pipe dream.” But look at you two, you’re really doing it. Going to China/Mongolia/Russia are not places that I would normally even consider, but China is sounding great and very interesting to read about it. As long as you’re happy with your trip, that’s the important thing. There will always be people that you think are doing something better/cooler/different than you, but only you have to be happy with your decisions. Enjoy!
